The 5 spice chicken bowl was tasty, as was the chicken itself but barely any noodles and tons of lettuce. Also, the cashier loudly yelling out people's pick-up numbers, despite it being a very small room, was very unpleasant and bordering on obnoxious. I don't think I'll be back.
author: Amanda W.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to get a quick bite especially around lunch time.  The duck bahn mi and vietnamese coffee is my go to.  Duck is always so juicy and delicious and the coffee is strong and sweet, just the way I like it!  I've also ordered the shrimp fresh roll and the  five spice chicken pho before which were mediocre in my opinion.  This place gets pretty packed during the weekdays during lunch time so get there early especially if you want a place to sit since space is limited.
author: Mei W.

description: I've been here several times now. Never had a bad meal. I just had the garlic butter chicken banh my. Omg! So savory.  The roll is crunchy on the outside,  incredible soft on the inside. The veggies are pickled perfectly,  and the chicken is amazing.  U can't bet the sandwich for $6
author: Matthew H.

description:
The "Bahn My" was pretty tasty -- the ingredients were fresh, the carrots were nicely pickled, and there was a good bite from the jalapeño. I had the roast pork "Bahn My", though I was tempted by the roast duck version.

Unfortunately, the bread was a little heavy and soaked up all of the juice. It fell apart as I was eating it and squirted pate-mayo on my hand :(

If the bread were a bit better off, this would easily be a 4-star Bahn Mi.
author: Chris M.

description: My first visit was not impressive...but they have certainly grown on me.  Ordering for take out is the best...their music is a wee bit too much for someone my age...
author: Barb L.

description:
Quick, fresh, satisfying, well-priced.

Great pricing and portions for such fresh-tasting food in Hayes Valley. You'd be hard-pressed to find anything of the same value in the neighborhood if you were trying to find something light and healthy.

As of this December, they've started accepting credit cards and have rearranged their layout

Finally, I usually have to wait no longer than 5 minutes for my food to come out which usually is not the case elsewhere in Hayes Valley.
author: Joshua O.

description:
My quick take:  Yum.  I'm coming back.

I worked from home last week Friday and finally got the change to pop in for lunch (at the time they were only open over lunch, M-F but now I think they've started weekends too).  I've noticed the space and saw this place coming up and have been waiting to try it out.

The space is cute and small.  It looks geared mostly for take-out, but they have bar seating that lets you people watch in Hayes Valley and a nice communal table.  The mixed woods on the table and bars is really cool.  I need to post some pics of it next time I try them out.

The food is really fresh and oh so tasty.  My main focus was the pork banh mi.  This was really delicious.  The pork was tender, juicy and had a lot of flavor.  I'm kinda salivating as I write this.  The pickled veg was fresh and crunchy.  Overall it was a well balanced sandwich with a hint of warming heat/spice.  

I also ordered the fresh spring rolls with veggies/shrimp.  It came with a great, standard peanut sauce.  Again, everything was super fresh.  They are made to order.  

Service was super polite.  The team is still getting used to their surroundings and ironing out the kinks.  And chatting with someone else there, it sounds like the owner is new to the restaurant world and just is just taking his love of food and his Vietnam roots and building a new business.

I'm anxious to return and try out the chicken and noodle dishes.  Happy eats everyone!
author: Mark F.

description:
Yummy food and the sweetest owners! I've gone twice this week and I'll be back again tomorrow! Love their Shrimp roll and tofu Ban mi. At another restaurant I've ordered a tofu Ban Mi and the tofu is shredded which makes it very dry. This was nice and moist and full of flavor. 
Great addition to Hayes Valley!
author: Melanie L.

description: Great Bahn mi and reasonable price!  Great spot and fast service. Would definitely recommend for a quick, cheap lunch.
author: Kate M.

description: Love the Bah mi  the green  papaya salad. Everything  is great. This place is addicting keep coming back for more. Just delicious.
author: Rafael M.

description:
I met up with a friend who lives in San Francisco for a nice lil lunch date.  Well why yes friend, I would love a splendid Bahn mi.

Cash only, super fast and pretty tasty bahn mi, free cucumber water.  Mama likes.

Wish the sandwiches had a bit more meat.  Maybe I'm just greedy.
author: Donna A.

description: Great place for a quick lunch. Fresh ingredients welcoming staff I would highly recommend giving it a try!
author: Dave S.

description: Love this place! Great food at affordable prices. Their duck banh mi is tender and flavorable and I really enjoy their teriyaki tofu spring rolls. Quick service, courteous staff and delicious food. What more can you ask for?
author: Alexandria D.

description: Leo suggested the pork belly and duck bahn my sandwich.  The star of this show is the duck.  The duck fat is awesome.  Maybe I'm bias towards duck fat, but something about it makes me smile.  The pork belly was good, but not on par with that duck fat.  Its your typical bahn my sandwich, carrot, cilantro, etc.  I just wish both sandwiches used a a soft bread.  It was a chore Biting into it.  It was tough,.but getting into the duck fat was worth it, SON
author: Chris P.

description: I get something from this establishment at least every other week. Bun Mi, Fresh Bowl, Spring Roll....all delicious.  Highly recommend the fresh lemonade as well.
author: Jennifer S.

description: This place is yummy! I went here before going to the SF Ballet, had a tofu bowl, it was great! I said if there was a place like this closer to my place I would go here all the time! Convenient, great food, so much flavor, fresh, will definitely visit again if I'm in the area!
author: Nicole M.

description:
Not impressed. To begin with its situated in an Asian neighborhood I already came with some pretty high standards. My bloodline runs right along the tight rope of Chinese and Cambodian so it would be a dummy whammy if this did not live up to par. Given the number of faulty and pathetic imitators in the local area,  being polite isn't just in my nature no more.

Only come here IF:

1)You would love a grain based cavitron root canal brought to you by rough bread central.
 Banh Mi bread is meant to be crunchy but not Transylvanian mortary solid (-1)

2). Veggies are nothing special to note.
 They are your average Chinatown on sale kind of texture. Nothing worthy to really remember about its taste...maybe with a little kimchi would help bring some semblance of flavor to what they have here.

3). From what I was told from my uncle who had come to visit from the mainland. He gave me a day long lecture for waiting what could a been parking garage money for food he could have made at home in the kitchen....his biggest complaint overall was that. He tasted soil...by that I take it that he also agrees that the freshness-flavor. Is very unappealing here....(-2)


This is for the lazy local for my first impressions. I'll come back if the TL becomes Anglo saxonized..
Its quick....but we all know how quicklys turned out.
author: Eric C.

description: One of the only affordable place in Hayes valley : I am addictive to the chicken bahn mi :-)
author: Arnaud M.

description:
the place was clean and the staff was friendly. 

teriyaki tofu was fresh, and delicious at a good price!
author: Paul P.

description: When I'm craving Banh Mi in hayes valley, I go here because well- there isn't another option. It is "okay" but honestly it could be better if they made a few changes. To get your grub vegan, you can ask them to substitute a vegan butter spread on the sandwich- but it taste a little odd to me. I think having a vegan mayo- like the sriacha just mayo would make a world of difference. Also- I wish they would let you add avocado like Dinosaurs does. Even though they have avocado in other dishes and clearly have it in the restaurant, they won't let you add it to your sandwich on principle. I don't get it.
author: Sky B.

description: The 5 spice chicken is great, easy fresh choice. The $6 for a sandwich is one of the best deals in the neighborhood. It's quick and highly recommend.   The Performing Arts Parking Garage is right there in case you're trying to park and then head somewhere. They're listed on Thanx Loyalty merchants for a loyalty program and my CC was recognized but I didn't see any additional deals.  That's alright though.
author: Corey O.

description: This place is just one block from my partner's home so we decided to go and try it out! We got a $6 fresh roll (shrimp) and a $6 fresh bowl. The fresh bowl was surprising so delicious with siracha and I loved the intricate mix of veggies and meat. (5 spice chicken is great!). Also the spring rolls were delicious too. That peanut sauce totally brings everything together.
author: Sharon Y.

description:
I dropped by here for a quick lunch and got myself a pork banh and a duck banh my.

The portions were pretty big and they don't cut corners on the meat even with the prices so low. The greens were good and the sauce they used is pretty incredible.

Staff is ultra friendly too!
author: Alexander C.

description:
This place is so friggin' awesome! I have had a lot of Vietnamese sandwiches in my day, and there's no wonder they are referred to the "poor man's meal." This is so not the case at Dragon Eats!

We tried:
-Pork Banh Mi
-Chicken Banh Mi
-Fresh Spring Rolls

All were impeccably made, fresh, and packed with flavor. I savored every single bite, and remained in an orgasmic state from start to finish. To top it off, the people who work here are humble, hard-working, and kind. The space, while small, is beautifully designed and inviting.

Bottom line: I cannot say enough good things about this place. I highly recommend it and encourage you to try it yourself. I will be back!
author: Jade F.

description:
Dragon eats takes Banh My to a whole new level of flavor! Every bite was a complex and full flavor.
The lemonade is also amazing. 
The people are gracious and pleasant. What a great little shop!
author: Patrick R.

description: Butter chicken for $7?!  Need I say more?  This is a filling sandwich, packed with flavor.  We will be back soon, great seeing this place.
author: Nathan M.

description: I have definitely had better Vietnamese food.  this isn't great but it isn't bad either.  The best part is the price!  It is pretty cheap for a lot of food.  I will for sure be back and ready to eat some more!
author: Walter B.

description: Super cheap, totally authentic and tasty. What more could you ask for? The 5 Spice Chicken bowl was the perfect size, and the Shrimp Rolls were super fresh and the sauce is divine. Yum. Yum. Yum!
author: Lesley N.

description:
Best Bahn Mi sandwich I've had in SF!

Food:
+Chicken Bahn Mi- $6 and the tasty flavor and fresh carrots and bell peppers made it amazing. THe bread was a little hard though.
+Soup- yummy gingery soothing soup; perfect to order when feeling a little sick
+Fresh Bowl with Tofu- leaves you feeling hungry at the end but still flavorful

Service:
Fast and friendly, but CASH ONLY!!

Ambience:
Very sunny spot that looks feels like a coffee shop or someone's dining room. THere's only one long communal dining table and the rest of the seats are along the window.

I'll definitely be back!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Yummy bahn mi at a very good price. Salad was good too! This is a great low-key lunch spot.
author: Zoey M.

description:
Good food, reasonable pricing, one of my go to spots for a quick and satisfying lunch. 
Staff is very friendly. I favorite things on the menu are the roasted pork and pork meatball banh mi as well as the Tofu salad bowl.
author: Jerry L.

description: This place is awesome if you want to grab something satisfying and quick to eat. It's a basic Vietnamese menu, nothing fancy, but they make it fresh on the spot and the food is quite good. I especially like their 5 spice chicken Bahn Mi. It's really good. When I have a short lunch at work I just pop in and in just a few min' i get my food. Their service is friendly, kind and quick.
author: Schisandra S.

description:
Minor hiccup.

Great dragon movie featuring Hiccup: www.wikipedia.org/wiki/How_to_Train_Your_Dragon_(film)

Good DragonEats sandwich with a hiccup: Pan fried tofu basted with teriyaki sauce and traditional Vietnamese fixings on a roll.

Price holds back star four. $6 is steep for something similar quality that can be found cheaper elsewhere. Yes Hayes Valley rents aren't cheap. And neither is the sandwich.

Friendly service and cozy multi-colored space add charm.

Overall good. Just doesn't soar as high as Toothless.
author: Jason B.

description: I've been here twice and I'm pretty impressed with the quality of the food and the price. The first time I got the 5 spice chicken bowl, which was great. The serving size is a bit on the small side, but it was only around $7 so all things considered, it was great. Today I had the roasted pork bahn mi and it was delicious. Crispy, fresh bread and veggies and the pork was flavorful and tender. The place is pretty small and gets cramped during the lunch rush, but there are plenty of places to eat around the area.
author: Brendan B.

description: Hayes Valley is in desperate need of more quick, affordable bites like DragonEats. This little spot is as unassuming as it gets, but the grub it serves up is delicious, comforting and cheap. I've ordered their fresh bowls, bahn mi and fresh rolls before, and they've all been delicious. It's counter-service and seat yourself but the crowd eats and moves quickly. During lunch hour, it can get a bit packed, but you can take the food to go easily. I'm a huge fan of this place, and it's my go-to for when I need a quick lunch in the neighborhood. Wish they were open for dinner!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I don't normally write reviews here but I had to for this place.

First off: only 4 stars for being cash only. Will services like Square and LevelUp and Paypal and others there is no excuse. Also, I rarely have cash so this will limit how often I am able to eat here.

Now for the real review.

The banh mi is just delicious. I don't need to say anything else. Just go get it. My favorite is the chicken but the pork is great too. This place is a great little gem in a neighborhood flooded with expensive restaurants. Good food and at a great price.

The service is great and fast. It seriously takes me longer to walk back to apartment than it took to order and get my food. I will definitely be coming back (and frequently).
author: Travis B.

description:
This place is perfect after a night of heavy drinking. They have a crispy noodle salad with chicken or pork and a light sauce on top. Also their sandwiches!

Food comes fast, lines are short -- a local's gem amidst the dizzying weekend lines in Hayes valley.
author: Christophe C.

description: DragonEats is a good spot to grab a quick bite, but it's nothing special. Although the ingredients are fresh, the Vietnamese sandwiches are relatively small for the price. For a better deal, go to Saigon Sandwich a few blocks away in the Tenderloin. I also tried their vermicelli bowls, which were a huge ripoff. The noodles they give you probably amount to a small handful. Overall, the flavor was good, especially the five spice chicken, but the meal was tiny and overpriced.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Just go there and get anything on the board. 
Nothing will make u regret. It will be out lunch spot from now on.  
Food are so delicious and fresh
I like the pork sandwich and the papaya salad. 
I tried their chicken salad too, it's also very delicious. 
Going to try their duck sandwich tmr!!!
author: xinyuan j.

description: This is a small "to-go" style Vietnamese Bun Mi, Salad, and Roll restaurant. It's not meant to be anything else, and they do a great job. I just had a fantastic duck sandwich that gave me a nice smile :D
author: Zack D.

description: Super packed but great place for lunch. The only downside is that it does not have a big enough space for people waiting to pick up their food. I personally don't like to hover around others while they are eating. Maybe they can put together something that displays a number outside to inform you when your order is ready, so you can hang out outside or something. You could be outside, but just that there wasn't a way to find out when your order was ready unless you kept looking inside. But either way the food is fresh and had great flavors- I personally love the 5-spice chicken bowl and shrimp spring rolls. Duck sandwich is also delicious but seemed small for the price. The Vietnamese iced coffee is also affordable at $3 compared to most places which charge more. Service is great.
author: Allyson L.

description:
I was itching for Pho/Vietnamese phood but couldn't go to quasi Little Saigon down the street since time wouldn't allow it. (Little Saigon title goes to Westminster,CA only which I deeply, deeply miss since moving to SF). 

The atmostphere was great but I'm not going to say the food was the best. I got the fresh bowl and spring rolls; was itching for Pho. 

Banh Mi roll was a bit tough and not enough veggies; miss that pickled carrotts/radish. Fresh Bowl wasn't exciting, it's refreshing though. 

Will come back around again when there is more time than lunch hour.
author: Christopher V.

description:
As a Hayes Valley resident for 5 years, DragonEats is a welcome change to the pricey/non-ethnic places in the 'hood. 

DragonEats is adorably decorated with Vietnamese books, bottles of Siracha, and authentic Vietnamese coffee cans. It's the perfect space to enjoy a quiet lunch with a book. I've tried almost everything on the menu. My favorite is the Vietnamese bowl with pork. My hubby loves the pork bahn mi. The coffee is a bit too sweet, but still tasty. 

The main reason for the 5 star review is that there is NOWHERE in Hayes Valley where you can get lunch for $6 and there are very few places where you can get delicious ethnic food (in a clean, friendly environment). Please frequent DragonEats so they become a Hayes Valley institution ASAP!
author: Shyla B.

description: Si good! Very affordable, unlike the rest of San Francisco. Try the duck banh mi= perfection
author: Eric V.

description:
The pork Bahn mi was delicious! Super moist but doesn't leave the roll soggy. The cucumber was a pleasant surprise :) 
-they do take out too, if your in a rush or want to eat at the park up the street
-There are a few bar stoles looking out towards Gough and a community table as well
And, the gentleman behind the counter was super sweet! 
Over all a great lunch spot!
author: Lauren B.

description:
more please.
Price, value, freshness 
It's a small space that kinda wants to be thought of as a food truck
It's  the kind of guilt free Sunday lunch I will go back to.
author: Neal M.

description:
Perfect little hole in the wall Vietnamese street food. First time I had a Bahn My and I loooved it!! I had the chicken and my husband had the duck. 
We also ordered a soup to share. Loved all the fresh veggies in the sandwich and the yummy ginger and veggie soup. Great price for Hayes Valley.Will be coming here regularly.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description: Delicious food. Cute atmosphere. A little busy when I was there... But they powered through the crowd just fine.
author: Eric D.

description: Got the green papaya salad with roasted pork. Great light high protein / low carb FRESH lunch. Pork had lots of flavor and was tender. Nice taste of peanuts and cilantro in salad. My husband had a garlic chicken ban mi recommended by the nice cashier and a kale soup which he liked too. For 6$, it is a great deal.
author: Leslie S.

description: Yum great banh mi sandwiches. Nothing else on the menu is that great. Also weird hours, they close by 6pm. Try it!
author: Ella M.

description: Totally love this place. I love the bahn mi sandwiches - love the 5 spice chicken and the duck. Love their fresh bowls (I've had the pork), as well as their fresh rolls (shrimp). I've tried a lot of items on their menu and everything is excellent. Wish this place was opened all day!!!
author: Maxine W.

description:
I LOVE this place.

I went here for lunch the other day and I had such a pleasant experience.

First of all, the food is delicious and moderately priced.  We got a chicken sandwich, Vietnamese iced coffee, and shrimp spring rolls.  Everything was yummy.  The sandwich was the most expensive thing and only around 6 bucks ... probably one of the most affordable meals available in Hayes Valley.

Secondly, the store was impeccably clean.  While very tiny, the staff keeps the store extremely tidy.  I actually wanted to stay in the store to eat lunch.  Nice hardwood tables, clean design, and cucumber water!

Finally, the staff is lovely.  When we realized this was a cash only place, my husband went outside to find an ATM.  The staff let me order AND gave me coffee and spring rolls while I waited for ca$h. This kind of trust goes a long way with me.  

Overall, I highly recommend this place for the yummy food and the friendly service.
author: Annie M.

description: One of the best banh mi vegetarian sandwiches I've had. The tofu is really well marinated and the service is super fast and good. Can't beat the price either. Highly recommend it
author: Parth S.

description: Super quick and easy, spicy as you want or don't want... this is a go-to lunch spot that's affordable and delish.
author: Regina D.

description: I had the 5 spice chicken noodle bowl and unfortunately this place doesn't hold a candle to the Vietnamese places in the Inner Richmond/Sunset. The fish sauce is dampened by vinegar- there's no fish flavor at all. It tastes like a plain citrus salad with strange textured chicken (maybe it was cooked in the morning?). All in all very Americanized-to-the-point-of-not-tasting-like-Vietnamese fare that I wouldn't recommend. Maybe the banh mis are better, but if you're craving real banh mi, go to the legit places in the Tenderloin, like Saigon Sandwich.
author: Fiona Y.

description: Good food, but they really have to stop serving sandwiches on rock hard stale bread. I literally just cut the top of my mouth eating one! Not cool!
author: Tyler B.

description: I had been craving some asian food, so I relied on Yelp to find me a good place nearby. I stopped by Dragon Eats one saturday to try out a 5 spice chicken bahn mi and some spring rolls. Overall I'd say the food was pretty good. The sandwich was generously filled with meat and veggies and the spring roll was fresh! It definitely hit the spot. My only complaint was price. It is way more expensive than I am using to paying for bahn mi back at home (I recently moved from Los Angeles). However I kind of expected that because they are located in the city.
author: Richard P.

description:
I'm a big fan! I'm not a very adventurous eater, but I went on a date and I'm glad I did. I've been back numerous times, always for the tofu sandwich (I'm a vegetarian).

Tofu sandwich has the right amount of spice and is really tasty. They are super fast in making my sandwich to-go. I should try the other vegetarian things on the menu, but I've found something so good I'm reluctant to try anything else!
author: Marcella D.

description: went her for lunch and had the 5 spice chicken salad with cabbage. pretty delicious and a good light/fresh lunch. i did ask them to do half shrimp and half chicken, but they said no (same price on the menu)... i might have to go back to try the shrimp. not too much space to eat inside but if you wait a few minutes tables free up/ most people get take away at lunch anyways... a decently affordable lunch in hayes valley.
author: Kam L.

description:
I feel compelled to review because of the handful of negative reviews. Bad reviews, for the most part, seem to be from right when they first opened (seriously people, it is so lame to bash a place after 1 visit after they have just opened. There is a reason food critics visit a place a few times before writing a review).

The food is good, clean and bright flavors, healthy, and SUPER CHEAP. Having a spot in Hayes Valley where you can get a filling meal for $6 is a rare and very welcome addition. The owner is super nice the space clean and inviting. I'm not a sandwich person, but the fresh rolls and fresh bowls are super tasty.
author: Natty C.

description: The food is fresh and delicious!  Not to mention, great prices. The staff friendly. The place is super clean. Great find!
author: Lisa D.

description: This place is really tasty AND really inexpensive. Great, fresh food w/ no fuss. In and out quickly every time, perfectly full.
author: Travis S.

description:
I had the pork banh mi sandwich.  Bread is by Bakers of Paris and is heated in an oversized toaster oven prior to preparation for the standard crunchy crust.  Pork is juicy, though I got quite a bit of tendon in my pieces.

Here's the killer -- $6.51 including tax.  *OUCH*  I understand this is Hayes Valley, but this sandwich isn't appreciably better than Saigon Sandwich, which is half the price.  I suppose I could say the same about the $9 burritos at Chez Maman, but they've got the full sitdown experience, whereas DragonEats feels like a storefront-based grab and go.  Also, the employees appear to be new -- the person taking my order forgot to press "total," so he was asking for $6.51 while the display showed $6.

Marking this as place "one-dollar sign" since it's technically under $10, but this should really be a "two-dollar sign" place using a banh mi standard.

3.5 stars for the banh mi, knocking one off for the price, making it 2.5 stars.  Rounded down to 2 because of the service.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I think that that some of the reviews for this place suck... mostly because they disliked this restaurant because similar restaurants are cheaper in other cities or neighborhoods.... and all I have to say is... 
"suck it! Hayes Valley is expensive!" 
I mean... I've lived here for a few years and rents have gone through the roof and I can totally understand why this restaurant charges $6 instead of $3 and I think that's ok and not a reason for bridge-and-tunnel type people to throw a bitch fit.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
Got a chicken banh mi here.  Was pretty good.  Actually, great.  Chicken was flavorful and tender.  Did I say tender?  I meant *tender*.  Yow!  Baguette was crisp and NOT chewy.  Overall, really tasty, and well worth the price.

I gotta try other things here, that's fer sure.

One downside: the place is a little seedy-looking.  But really, for such great banh mi, you gotta be willing to put up with that .....
author: Chet M.

description: Great place. Great prices, good portions (not too big, not too small), and fast service. Great place for a light, quick lunch in Hayes Valley. Will be going again.
author: Peter B.

description:
Simple place- just Vietnamese Sandwiches, Rice bowls (I haven't tried these), spring rolls and soup.  

AVOID THE SOUP!  It is just macaroni and chopped previously frozen vegetables.  Would it be too much to ask for them to serve mini-Pho instead (like in Vietnam on every street)?  

The chicken bun mee is great (duck is even better) and the vietnamese coffee is a nice addition to any mid-work-day lunch.
author: M S.

description: Duck banh mi is the absolute best! Have yet to try the bowls but they look amazing as well.
author: Jane L.

description: I just tried this place. It is amazing. Totally fresh and yummy and TONS of vegetarian/vegan options (be sure you tell them not to use fish sauce). I ate too much precisely because it was so good. Highly recommended and a great value too.
author: Brian K.

description:
I have visited Dragoneats twice: at lunch time during the week and on the weekend.  

This cafe has a small menu and serves up what it advertises- simple Vietnamese street food. Bahn mi, rolls, salads.With only 4 or 5 menu offerings (that can be customized with your choice of pork, chicken, or tofu)  DragonEats is able to offer fresh fare.

I have had the bahn mi with tofu and the papaya salad. My bahn mi was solid but not as spicy as i would have liked (though i requested it spicy). At $6 it is almost twice the price of the near by bahn mi shops in the tenderloin but  the line at Dragon Eats is not as long and i felt that the quality of the sandwich was good and had more fresh vegetables in it. 

My papaya salad  with tofu was also great . Come here if you are looking for a healthy lunch for less than $10 in Hayes Valley.


Note that their sign on the menu let's you know that they are still getting a hang of things and it may take a while to get your food. Take the sign seriously!  Expect to wait a little longer than you would expect for your food or even better, just call it in.
author: Leuwam T.

description:
I ordered the Fresh Bowl with chicken ($6.00+ tax). Cash only. The chicken tasted better than my first visit in September. My bowl had fresh vegetables, light noodles, peanuts; some pickled carrots and fried shallots making for a tasty mix. The fish sauce was almost perfect, not too sweet and not extremely salty, similar to the way my mom and grandma use to make. It was a small bowl but I had to remember this is normally the size in Vietnam. Sure I could go to the Tenderloin to get a larger bowl. But I'm being greedy since that's American sized portions. I was full after eating my bowl anyways. If I was still hungry, I'd order more food. 

     The place was more crowded during lunch. There's more staff. Service was quicker than my first visit. I grab some water and some utensils and sat at the large table with a bunch of basils and Vietnamese herbs in the middle. Nice floral decoration (overhearing some customers sitting nearby) but being Vietnamese, I knew they're edible, grab a handful and tossed them into my bowl. Almost like home. :o)
author: Sarah N.

description:
Just had a sandwich here.  Fast, tasty and hit the spot after my 2 hr yoga class (never want to eat anything heavy afterwards).

This is a better tasting sandwich than the cheaper $3 sandwiches in the Tenderloin.  Honestly, yes, you can find a cheaper sandwich but walking (or even driving) through the Tenderloin makes me lose my appetite.  Seriously, meth addicts always gravitate to me.  They love to talk to me and tell me how beautiful I am.  Think it's because I have all my teeth.

But, my sandwich was only $6 which is a steal for what I got.  Got a pork sandwich and the sandwich was warm, nicely seasoned, and dripping with juiciness.  I brought my sandwich home but will probably just eat it there next time while it's fresh and hot.  It's a nice clean space.  Husband who typically doesn't eat Vietnamese sandwiches even said it smelled better than other sandwiches I've brought home and wants to try one next time.

Also, the staff was really nice and friendly.

Only minor comment.  I drive on Gough everyday and have never seen this place.  Would have walked past it if I didn't have the address.  Wish the store/sign popped out a little better (maybe a bigger or brighter store sign?).  All in all, love this place and will be back soon.
author: Shelly W.

description:
I come here a lot. Yes, banh mi is $3 in the wonderful Tenderloin, but $6 is still fine for San Francisco. Better than some B.S. sandwich that's $10. You live in an expensive ass city, deal with it.
Always friendly, quick and delicious. Place is super clean. Great spot for Hayes Valley. Owner is a great guy, always has a smile on his face. Plus, they have great books about Vietnam to look through while your waiting.
author: J B.

description: The food here tastes great, based on the rolls that I had.  However, I'm taking off a star because it's small and therefore hard to find seating if you come during lunch hour, although we got lucky and found seats.  Also, the portions are smaller than I thought they would be, and my coworkers agreed.  However, the price is reasonable (maybe having to do with the smaller portions).  The Vietnamese ice coffee is also excellent.
author: a f.

description:
Probably the best deal, healthiest option in the performing arts/Civic Center/Hayes Valley area. 

$6 for dinner, more if you add a drink. CHEAP EATS!!!! The shrimp roll is great. If you are gluten free, just get fish sauce, no peanut sauce. A small place, its bright, clean, airy and has enough seating or you can take away. Very casual, fast and delicious.

Street metered parking or side streets with no meters. 

The homemade lemonade is a treat. Enjoy!

Friendly staff too. No minimum on credit/debit cards. Kaching! They got my business!
author: F M.

description: Very tasty food at excellent prices.  I got a great and very filling dinner for less than seven dollars.  The people are very nice which makes a difference.  This is close to being five stars for me, but not being able to get food on plates instead of only disposable bothers me even though I am pretty sure that is dictated by local regulations for this particular space.  This is one of the best places to eat in the area and that is saying a lot as there is stiff competition nearby demanding high prices.
author: Christian M.

description: This spot is so GREAT for someone who's on-the-go and looking for a great quality sandwich. The Garlic Butter Chicken is full of flavor and well worth the $6.50 I paid. To top it off the service here is spectacular. Very friendly family owned business. It's definitely a hidden gem in The City!
author: Melanie-LaCresha M.

description: Huge cringe at any Yelper that gave this place less than 5 stars.
author: Raja S.

description: The tofu banh mi was great by what I consider to be my pretty high banh mi standards. The staff was super friendly as well. I didn't realize it was cash only, and only had $5 on me. They said I could just pay back the rest next time, and I will because it was that good. The lemonade was also delicious!
author: John K.

description:
Such a great lunch option for fresh quick, healthy food under $7. Only downside is that they only take cash. If you find yourself without cash, don't worry, they often let you order first and then go to the ATM so you don't have to waste time!

I recommend the papaya salad with chicken and I always substitute the cilantro for jalapeños...
author: Ariel M.

description:
A little context: I've been to Vietnam, where the food is amazing 99% of the time. And I've had "bun thit nuong" there, which is the equivalent of what I got at DragonEats, the Fresh Bowl with pork. This is also my first bowl of kinda-bun-thit-nuong in San Francisco. Also, I'm a frugal college student.

I was rather disappointed with the amount of noodles. It was very, very little. There was a ton of plain shredded lettuce that made the bowl look full. I might have a larger stomach and a shallower wallet than others who have said the portions here are perfect for lunch. $6 for a dish like this is a good price, but I wasn't satisfied. I'll admit there was a nice amount of pork, but sadly it didn't taste extraordinary, just good. Plenty of roasted peanuts and fried onions was a nice touch.

The worker told me the Fresh Bowl wasn't exactly bun thit nuong, which is perhaps why they emphasized the vegetables, totally skimped on the noodles, and why the meat wasn't what I'm used to.

The decor is cool, and the whole place is super clean. Service is great. Workers are extremely nice. Maybe I'll be back to try something else.
author: Kevin M.

description: Wonderful staff good food clean environment. I will have to get 2 items next time to get full. The food was delicious.
author: John H.

description: Wonderful staff, offers an all-vegan sandwich, quick, as cheap as subway and waaaay better food. Love Love.
author: Julianne P.

description: A hidden gem in Hayes Valley! The prices and tofu fresh rolls are by far the best I've had in SF. But basically everything on the menu is awesome. They give you just right portions too. Not too much or too little. Too bad they don't stay open past 6. I'd eat every meal here if I could.
author: Phil M.

description:
I stumbled upon DragonEats on a lunch break at work and have been back a few times to stuff my face.

The staff is so friendly and sweet, last time I was there eating like my life depended on it, they were giving away free cups of soup as well.  Yum.  

I honestly have nothing bad to say about DragonEats: fresh food, the portions are not monstrous (just perfect for lunch), quick and easy to eat there or grab something to go, and every single thing you put in your mouth is so dang delicious (except maybe don't eat a napkin).  The staff didn't even glare at me when I took seven Andes mints off the counter (I love love love them).

Whether your having the spring rolls and peanut sauce or a fresh bowl, I know your taste buds will be applauding - just remember to bring cash!
author: Allyson D.

description:
I got bowls to-go for lunch here today, pork for my co-workers and chicken for me.  The whole ensemble works well together.   The noodles are cooked just right, not too al-dente.  The chicken pieces pack quite a lot of flavor (my co-workers think the meat are braised). The iceberg lettuce and carrots are all chopped toothpick size to maximize the crunch.  The only question I have to ask is, why so little??  Understand I don't usually gripe about portion sizes since I usually get full fairly quickly.  But the serving sizes here are like the size of a small rice bowl.  And to emphasize just how little we're getting, they have to-go boxes so enormous our food look like they are cowering in a tiny corner inside.  I realize this is a Hayes Valley business and rent is pricier in this neighborhood, but how much more would it have cost them to add another handful of vermicelli in each order?

So, I may come back, but only when I'm not really hungry...
author: Yvette F.

description: This just rates the Bahn Mi sandwich that we had.  It was pork.  We love Bahn mi, have it wherever we find it, and make our own.   This Bahn mi here was just ok.  The bread was way to chewy.  It gave my jaw a real work out.  The pickle daikon and carrots were good but the pork flavor was way to subtle.  So it was a really chewy not so flavorful ok sandwich.
author: Bob K.

description: Came here for lunch, was surprised with the best Vietnamese food I've ever tasted. Try it and you won't regret it.
author: Tony D.

description: Another one of the best things to come to Hayes Valley in recent years. Super fast service, decent price (for HV), and excellent bahn mi make this place a staple lunch spot.
author: Christian S.

description: Love this place. Wish they had a location in SoMa. The tofu Banh Mi is amazing and the fresh rolls are the best and it's all really cheap. The staff is super nice to boot. I haven't tried any of the meat but I'm sure it's amazing :-)
author: Julie H.

description:
I loathe working in Hayes Valley sometimes but this gives me a shred of light when it comes to lunch options. 
Affordable and possibly the best pork bahn mi I've ever eaten. Lots of details to still work out as we went in their opening day, but it looks like they're working on it. 

Planning in going back ver soon. Our Intern has gone 2 days in a row for the Bun so it must be decent. Waiting to try the iced coffee, but the jelly lemonade a nice treat albeit random for Hayes valley. 

Thanks Dragon Eats for moving into the hood.
author: Niki M.

description:
Awesome. Really pleased with this place. 

I've had their papaya salad with shrimp and their chicken salad, and both were awesome lunches. Fresh, crispy, balanced, and light. The service was very friendly and quick. The place is bright and clean. And for $6, my lunch was a steal by Hayes standards (or, in fact, SF standards). I'd definitely go back whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Sasha K.

description: The bowls are pretty delicious. Standard Vietnamese bowls but they are only 6 dollars. Portions are medium sized and just right for a girl. I would think guys would still be hungry after. Inconvenient that they only take cash. Nice little place to eat at a good price in hayes valley.
author: Noji N.

description: Really good banh mi made with fresh ingredients: it melt on your mouth. The crust of the bread is perfectly crusty. There is also a nice choice of bowl. Other great thing ... the price!
author: Harry V.

description: The Banh My Vietnamese sandwiches are incredible delicious. Very reminiscent of the food from Vietnam. Very reasonably priced as well. I was even $1 short, (they take cash only) and the man working named Andy said I could come in later and pay for the entire meal. I will surely be back to DragonEats.
author: Woody F.

description: Awesome service and it is a welcoming place first and foremost. The food is good. We still have to come back and get more food and return a favor to the owner. Awesome business.
author: P L.

description:
My girls and I have been on a new kick when it comes to eating out- we're trying to eat at as many different cuisines as possible from all around the globe. Our latest trip was to DragonEats to check off Vietnamese food. I gotta say, if all vietnamese food is similar to DragonEats then I've found a new cuisine that I love!

I myself went with a Banh My, aka vietnamese sandwich. They sure know how to make sandwiches here! After much debate and indecisiveness that led me to tell multiple people to order in front of me because I hadn't made a decision yet, I decided to go with the five spices chicken.....amazing! 

Tons of chicken flavored fantastically on delicious bread STUFFED with tons of tasty, fresh veggies. I decided to compliment this with a shrimp spring roll and some of their lemonade. Everything was delish and made for one amazing dinner. I shall be back...SOON!

Two thumbs way up!
author: Elaine M.

description:
Love this place. Fast, good, fresh and tasty food to go.

Ordered :
5 Spice Chicken Banh My - 5/5 . Have ordered this every time.

Will order again : 5/5 . Definitely.
author: Rachit A.

description: Stopped in and ordered chicken Banh Mi - a sandwich on a baguette-style bread.  It was ready within just a couple of minutes, and was delicious.  They were glad to make it without cilantro and the order came out just as requested.  I may head out for another later it was so tasty.
author: George S.

description: Excellent spring rolls with shrimp and their pork Vietnamese sandwich was quite tasty. Quick and efficient service too.
author: Matt C.

description:
Concise Vietnamese street food menu- banh mi, rolls, and noodles in a light, airy space. Designed for take away but there are about 12 seats.  I had five spice chicken on rice noodles. Loved the crispy veggies and crispy fried shallots & garlic that topped the bowl.

It's cash only, so come prepared.
author: Kat M.

description:
Walking to my bank I needed something to eat.  I wanted delicious with a reasonable price tag, not common for Hayes valley.  

I got the pork fresh bowl, and the soup of the day which was chicken broth and vegetables.

The pork bowl was cold rice noodles, with a bed of lettuce and some other veggies on it, topped with some delicious roast pork.  The soup had a great taste to it, and I actually regretted adding sriracha!

the two items were under $10 so i was pleased.  The rest of the food i saw other people ordering looked great, particularly the Banh Mi, which at 6 bucks seemed steep but it is of a much higher quality than what I typically see.

THe only thing I was not a fan of was that even dining in everything came in a togo container.  I am not a fan of unecessary waste.  If this must be the way they do it to save the time and space in the small kitchen I would like to see compostable plastic utensils and containers/lids.

If they get plates and flatware they get that 5th star.  If they go compostable they get another .5
author: Tom L.

description: I love this place! The food is fresh and delicious, the staff are sweet, it is sunny inside and everything comes out lightening fast! Everything on the menu is $6. It's cash only, and one day I forgot, they totally spotted me lunch and let me pay next time I was in. Who does that? I treat people here all the time because the price is so reasonable and you can spend the majority of your lunch break eating--not waiting for food, table, etc. Love these guys!
author: Gabby G.

description: Our professor catered Bahn Mis from DragonEats for us, and I was very impressed (Had the Pork and Steak). Seems a lil pricey judging by other yelp reviews, but still under $10.  Would have to say that's a bargain in this city.  Will def come here sometime to check out the rest of their menu.
author: Joshua P.

description:
Great bahn mi, especially the chicken. Very friendly counter staff.

Only feedback would be that portions need to be larger.
author: jason e.

description: Okay, the staff at DragonEats have cleaned their ears... Now they actually listen to what I order. Yay! I do enjoy the banh mi without the jalapeño. Very tasty.
author: Diana G.

description: This place sandwiches are surprisingly better than down Little Sai Gon. A little pricey yes but then again it's in a nice area and they put a lot of meat for you too. Very good customer service. Nice job :)
author: Ly L.

description: I don't know what the people who've given these guys anything less than 5 stars is talking about!! I have tried MANY Vietnamese sandwiches from MANY different locations and none compare to the quality and delicious taste of Dragon Eats sandwiches. They are just SO GOOD and not only that, they are consistently good. There's never been a day where I've had an off sandwich. It's always perfect. Their spring rolls are also super yummy. The wraps are always fresh, never hard like at some other locations. They also offer complimentary cucumber water. How cool is that?! Yes, I agree $6 is high but you can't get the same level of awesome food at any of the other places that offer sandwiches for $3. It's CASH ONLY so come prepared but otherwise, you will definitely fall in love with this place. I wish I lived in the city so I could have lunch here all the time!
author: Amanda C.

description: Vu is so awesome. We ordered a bunch of Bahn mi and a tray of spring rolls for a party in the park. He was super responsive and able to do everything we wanted and had it ready before the store even opened! It was a big hit as the food is delicious and we were psyched because it was so reasonably priced.
author: Jenya K.

description:
A straightforward menu with delicious food (sandwiches and rolls - we didn't try the bowl) at reasonable prices. I'm glad we found this place and I'm intending to return.

If you're looking for a fine dining experience, this isn't your place. If you want something delicious with an informal atmosphere, you won't be disappointed.
author: Garrett R.

description: This a great quick drop in , pick up lunch spot near the courthouse. The food is fresh and has traditional Vietnamese flavor. They have a short menu that is pretty straight forward . Small quaint spot if you want to sit down as well. I will definitely be going back if I am in the neighborhood..
author: Das M.

description: Yummy food. Friendly staff. Fresh ingredients and cool atmosphere. Great light lunch.
author: Cath L.

description: Best bahn mi I've ever had hands down. Cozy and down to earth atmosphere. A great place to grab a quick lunch.
author: K R.

description: I absolutely hate yelp but I love this place so much I had to come on here just to give it 5 stars because the people that work there are so sweet and I always leave satisfied.
author: Kyra W.

description: It's a really simple menu, but with the most delicious bright flavors and really fresh ingredients.  Choose a meat or tofu on light rice noodles or in a baguette, or a fresh summer roll.  I thought the bread was going to be too bready but it had a great texture of crispy and chewy, and wasn't too filling at all.
author: Melanie C.

description: Dragon Eats is a cozy and clean spot serving up banh mi and noodle bowls in Hayes Valley.  After the stellar reviews, I was psyched to finally walk down from the Tenderloin on my lunch break. I ordered a chicken noodle bowl, which was tasty and fresh. The service during the crowded lunch hour was extremely friendly and remarkably fast.  However, my single gripe was paying $6 for a bowl consisting of mostly shredded iceberg lettuces and noodles. There was virtually no chicken included, so I definitely felt more than a little short changed. Always one for magnanimity, I'd try Dragon Eats again, but maybe order the roast duck banh mi and skip the noodle bowl.
author: Ryan S.

description: Great lunch place if you're in Hayes Valley, don't want to spend a lot and want something fast!  For $6 you can get a yummy rice bowl with a variety of main toppings - tofu was my favorite with chicken coming in at #2.  Others have told me their chicken Banh Mi is pretty delicious but I haven't personally tried it but it's on my list to try!
author: Lisa K.

description: Hands down the best Bahn Mi I've had in SF! Their bread is light, crunchy, and toasted, their veggies and proteins are fresh, they add just the right quantity of spicy peppers, and they top it all off with a great sambal sauce. The first time I came here, I got two, because it was so yummy, made so quickly, and so cheap! ($6)
author: Max S.

description: Maybe I wasn't in the best mood, but this place ticked me off because it was cash only. I definitely didn't get the impression of that when I walked in because it looked very modern and they had computers at the register. It didn't help that the bill came out to 6.51. At least the food was good.
author: Mariusz L.

description: They really have the best chicken sandwich in the neighborhood. However my frustration and disappointment with this sandwich shop is based on the fact that even after specifically mentioning that I do not want certain ingredients in my sandwich, I end up with those ingredients 9 out of 10 times. Guys, please work on your order taking skills. I really like the food, but it is extremely frustrating to unwrap your sandwich and find that it is not the way you ordered it.
author: Sami W.

description: Pretty tasty, and good options. My rolls could've used more sauce. Had a salad last time- it was tasty. Prices are reasonable and proportional to the decent portions.
author: Chris M.

description: The yin&yang of banh my: crunchy outside juicy inside. Also the most affordable in Hayes Valley
author: Hung D.

description:
if you're complaining about paying $6 for a lunch in hayes valley, you're an idiot. this isn't the TL, and if that's what you're looking for, go there.

the ingredients at dragoneats are fresh, the flavors are bright, the food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the place is impeccably clean. i'll definitely be back.
author: Kate F.

description: Tried the bahn mi here. It was ok, bread extra hard and smaller than what you'd typically get elsewhere. Asked for extra sauce but there was none, almost no sauce in the sandwich.. and having barely any sauce ruins the experience for me. I really wanted it to be a great experience though, looked like a cool place.
author: May G.

description: This place was delicious. We first got the fresh rolls with tofu.... fresh, lots of cilantro (which I love), the peanut dipping sauce wasn't overly peanutty or rich, and the rice paper wasn't too sticky. I then ordered the tofu banh mi which was really good. I'm not a fan of mayonnaise, so I got the garlic mayonnaise on the side and just added a little bit, but the other ingredients were very fresh and the baguette wasn't too hard. With the sriracha bottle in hand to spice it up, this sandwich was extremely good... just about on par with the banh mi I was used to eating at Num Pang in midtown NYC. $6 for a sandwich is also a good deal.... definitely go check it out.
author: Bharathram L.

description:
i've come to really love this place, and in the past couple of months, i've become quite the regular!  the only reason i don't show up there more than once a week is they close at 5 pm, and i'm never home from work by then, so it's become quite the weekend treat for me.  i actually feel sadness...and a bit of withdrawal...when they've been closed during the holiday weeks (i.e., thanksgiving & christmas-new year's).

i usually order the same thing - the fresh noodle bowl w/chicken.  i've also tried it with pork & tofu, but i prefer the chicken.  i think the pork and the tofu could use a bit more flavor and spice (note, the same for the tofu spring roll).  i've yet to try the sandwiches, which i've heard are really good...i've just had a difficult time ordering something other than the noodle bowl since it's a healthier option compared to everything else around hayes valley!  one day...i'll give in...

the staff is really friendly - always smile when i walk in, and are courteous and seem appreciative for my business.  just remember, the place only takes cash...no plastic, so come prepared!
author: Kelly T.

description: Great banh my! I got the 4 spice chicken and Vietnamese coffee. Filling  combo but the chicken is a bit tough.
author: R S.

description: I've had the pork and chicken fresh bowls. For $6, you get a good amount of veggies and meat. The pork and chicken were both tasty.
author: Amy K.

description: Stopped by here for a quick bite to eat. Nice little hip joint. I ordered the shrimp rolls. Pretty delicious. Decent prices and only took a few minutes to get my order. The cashier was friendly. The restaurant was nice and clean.
author: Kelly B.

description: The food is fresh an delicious, but the portions are a little light and the prices are about as far from a street in Vietnam as one could imagine. A little pricy for bahn mi, but the flavor is amazing. If the prices were about a dollar an entree less it would be five stars without a second thought.  That being said, I'm sure the owners are just paying the rent and I would definitely eat there again if I was nearby.
author: Scott P.

description:
in a word - refreshing. 

it's utterly refreshing to walk into a nice restaurant, right off of hayes, and not walk out feeling like i overpaid for my food. and to top it off, it's great food! 

the veggies are fresh, the meats are lean (surprising and rare for most asian restaurants...), the place is cute and clean with splashes of culture. 

they're banh mi is delicious (i've tried the pork), but my favorite has been the fresh bowls. these are modeled after the vietnamese "bun" or vermicelli dishes - rice noodles mixed with marinated meat, a plethora of veggies (lettuce, cilantro, pickled carrots, touches of mint) and topped with just enough toasted garlic and peanuts for texture. of course, you have to douse it all in fish sauce to make it complete. 

highly suggested next time you're in hayes valley and looking for a light lunch - that'll leave you some change to spare for a stop at smitten ice cream...hm, they should do a vietnamese coffee flavor one of these weeks...
author: Thu C.

description: Banh mi for $6 in Hayes Valley? Win! The bread was appropriately crunchy and the meat was flavorful and not dry. This is definitely one of my go-to's in the neighborhood for a quick weekday lunch.
author: Judy L.

description: Just went there for the first time today. Got the chicken sandwich. It was pretty tasty. I'm a big meat guy and don't really LOVE veggies, but it still tasted really good. It's the cheapeast option to eat at near my work, so I'll be coming back. Only complaint is that it didn't fill me up, so if you're hungry, get a side item too.
author: Steve D.

description: I found this place on Yelp while wedding dress shopping with my bridal party.  Once I heard they had Duck Banh Mi, we just had to try it! The BEST EVER!!!! Everytime we make a trip out there I make it a point to pass by and grab 1 or 2 sandwiches.  I'd give them 5 stars except it is CASH only, which is kind of a bummer.
author: Charize J.

description: Definitely my favorite Vietnamese sandwich in San Francisco.
author: RJ J.

description: Some of the bear local Vietnamese food I've found in this city. Lovely service too. Highly recommended. Specifically the chicken sandwich!
author: Mark S.

description: Awesome! I had the tofu spring roll. The ingredients were fresh and the peanut dipping sauce was amazing. The Vietnamese coffee was also delish. Definitely coming back to try more of the menu.
author: Mark S.

description: I frequent DragonEats during the week for lunch while I'm working. This is such a great hidden gem for those of us who work at mid-market. Yes, $6 is steep compared to other Vietnamese places in the city, but it is much much cheaper than paying $12 for a sandwich from anywhere else near by. They are also SO friendly, and their coffee is great. I switch between the freshbowls and the duck bahn mi and it's always been fantastic.
author: Meg W.

description: I had the pork noodle bowl today for lunch ($6), which was delicious but a disappointingly small amount of food. I ordered to-go, but when I opened the box I almost thought they gave me an incomplete lunch. The food only took up half the box, with only a mouthful of noodles covered in a mound of lettuce and other misc veggies, and a few thin slices of pork on top. The dressing on the veggies and the flavor of the meat were great, but unless you're light eater I'd suggest ordering multiple items from the menu.
author: Camille L.

description:
This place is delicious!  The decor is cute, the staff is friendly and accomadable (I always ask for chicken instead of shrimp in my spring rolls), and the food is grrrrreat!  

The pricing is reasonable given it's in the city IN Hayes Valley.  People need to stop complaining about pricing. 
I hope they extend hours soon!  That one is a head scratcher for me...
author: Amy M.

description: I really love this place. I'm really limited on what I can get because I'm Vegan, but they are always very, very accommodating and make sure there is no fish sauce. The food is really fresh and the tofu is marinated and yummy. I think they should expand the menu and hours a bit--especially with more Vegan options. One time I called after hours and the man was still willing to let me come and pick something up. You have my heart and tummy.
author: Ryan K.

description: This has become one of my favorite lunch spots in Hayes Valley, where I work 3 days a week. The food is delicious, fast, and inexpensive; I usually get the pork fresh bowl and shrimp spring rolls for $13 total. The location is very pleasant and clean, and the staff is always super friendly. What's not to love?
author: Kent H.

description: This is a great place for cheap, good lunch food.
author: Berkeley A.

description: Fresh, delicious, affordable, and expeditious! Found this place on a Sunday when we were in the area for the Asian Art Museum and the opera. All food items $6-10.  We wanted a quick bite, and this hit the spot. We had a chicken banh my and a shrimp papaya salad. Both were packed with fresh veggies (they were grating daikon and carrot as we were ordering) , and the chicken and shrimp were great, too. We'll be back!
author: Susan P.

description: This is a good lunch spot, especially for take-out, which is what we usually do. I have the Fresh Bowl, Tofu or Pork, on a regular basis. It is $6.00, and nutritious and filling. It's my most frequent lunch.
author: Caterina F.

description: Banh Mi abounds in San Francisco, but this new place might have my favorite. This place has only been open for a month or two and I've already been here probably six times to pick up chicken and pork Banh Mi for me and my girlfriend. The spring rolls are also insanely good, better than any that I've tried a few blocks away in Little Saigon. One of the best lunch spots in Hayes Valley and definitely the best value.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Great place with a cool vibe and yummy, fresh food.
Prices are awesome!!  Portions are on the small side, if you're really hungry a meal here might not cut it.
But it's a great spot for lunch and I will definitely be back!
author: Holly P.

description: Love this place. Tasty sandwiches. Fast service. Reasonably priced. Gem of a place. Only wish parking was easier, but that's a neighborhood issue.
author: Catherine P.

description:
Last year I was introduced to Banh Mi sandwiches and since then, I have been on an eating adventure to find the best sandwiches. 

I was very excited when I stumbled upon DragonEats in my neighborhood!  Unfortunately, my excitement was fleeting.

The space is very cute and the owners seem passionate about what they are cooking, however my Banh Mi experience was very underwhelming.

I am vegan, so I ordered the tofu Banh Mi.  While the bread was good, crisp on the outside, the ratio of tofu to carrots was underwhelming (the carrots won), and the tofu tasted like it was basted in teriyaki instead of some other amazing sauce.  They also put too many jalepenos on the sandwich, which made the whole experience, well hot.  Perhaps their meat items are better, however if you're going to serve meat alternatives, you need to put some more effort into it.

DragonEats needs to work on their ratios of protein to veggies in their sandwiches, and perhaps try a different sauce on their tofu.  

In my quest, the most amazing Banh Mi sandwich I've found in SF is by Banh Mi Love You Long Time.  Find BMLYLT on Facebook and fall in love with amazing food!
author: sari r.

description: I love eating here; the food is supremely fresh and delicious - the service is friendly and smiles abound.  I'll post pix of the Spring Rolls, the Papaya Salad w/Shrimp, and the Noodle Bowl w/Pork shared by three with a second order of the Spring Rolls because it was such perfect goodness and we didn't/couldn't stop eating.
author: Geri S.

description: This little restaurant is fantastic. My first visit wasn't the best, but now after my 20th visit, I love it. Shrimp rolls and tofu rolls are delicate and expertly made. All banh mi is delicious; I love pork meatball. 5 spice noodle/salad bowl is great, as well as non-noodle salad. Everything is $6!
author: Phern H.

description: This place is awesome! The Chicken Bahn My is wonderful and has so much flavor!  The people working there are very nice and you get your food in no time. I'm absolutely going to make this a regular lunch spot.
author: Lauryn G.

description: Delicious banh mi and vietnamese iced coffee! CASH ONLY though (as of this writing)
author: Kai C.

description: The place is cash only. Of course, just moved to SF, I didn't have cash. They let me have the food without paying and told me just pay next time. Omg, so definitely 5 stars and visit again
author: Suki C.

description: People are very nice, sandwiches are a little pricy. Great little place...glad it's here. Wish the hours were extended!
author: Calvin R.

description: I love this spot - such a great addition to the lunch time choices in the neighborhood! chicken bahn mi, fresh bowl and shrimp spring roll are all favorites. Such a friendly and welcoming place!
author: C B.

description: great spring rolls and banh mi! on a par with saigon sandwich, if pricier, but you don't have to stand in line and be harassed by panhandlers and you can actually eat there. nice vibe, good variety.
author: Justin S.

description: Wonderful-fresh, delicious, quick and always very friendly. I have to eat there at least once a week! My favorites-pork sandwich, shrimp papaya salad, fresh shrimp rolls. YUM!
author: y t.

description: delicious! a little more than i'd like to pay for the amount you get but the quality is definitely there. the old adage is true: you get what you pay for.
author: Janet R.

description: I ordered the rice noodle bowl which, like everything else here, was made to order. The service was friendly, my order (which I took to go) was ready within a few minutes. My food was fresh, made of quality ingredients and reasonably priced. I will definitely frequent this lunch spot!
author: Andria S.

description: Found DragonEats on the way to the Symphony yesterday.  What a delight -- light, fragrant, delicious meal.  My pork bowl had just the right mix of meat, noodles and vegetables.  Flavors were clear and distinct, not the "muddy" quality that sometimes characterizes inexpensive Asian food.  The bowl was not large, and for $6 I didn't expect it to be -- it was a perfect sized meal. Excellent Vietnamese ice coffee as well!
author: Doug G.

description: this place is my "grab a quick bite" lifesaver. work in the area and its always nice to come here and grab a quick bite before i have to go to work. my favorite eat: pork banh mi. never super busy and always get my order within 10 minutes of ordering. they are quick and delicious!
author: Josephine S.
